Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of elaborate rosette in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; exterior: uncertain dotted motif at left and possible hand in outline; dotted squared cross as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the dotted pattern, see the possible dotted animal skin on British Museum 1888,0601.486 where the human figure is also depicted in outline.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0835) (phase 2)
